label: HKZW-SO01
description: Smart Plug with Two USB Ports

paramInformation.label: Overload Protection
paramInformation.description: If current exceeds 16.5A over 5 seconds, relay will turn off.

paramInformation.label: Notification on Load Change
paramInformation.description: Smart Plug can send notifications to association device load state changes.

paramInformation.label: Indicator Modes
paramInformation.description: LED in the device will indicate the state of load

paramInformation.label: Threshold of Power Report
paramInformation.description: Power Threshold at which to send meter report

paramInformation.label: Percentage Threshold of to Trigger Power Report
Power Report Frequency
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending power report to association device (Group Lifeline).

paramInformation.label: Energy Report Frequency
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending energy report to association device (Group Lifeline).

paramInformation.label: Voltage Report Frequency
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending voltage report to association device (Group Lifeline)

metadata.inclusion:
Automatic Non-Secure Inclusion
1. Perform the steps in the INSTALLATION section above. If the plug-in has not already been included into a Z-Wave network, the LED indicator will blink rapidly. Otherwise, the plug-in has already been included and should first be excluded by following the instructions in the EXCLUSION section below.
2. Set your Z-Wave controller into learning mode (refer to your controller's manual for instructions). The plug-in should be recognized and automatically included into your Z-Wave network.
3. The auto-inclusion function will be disabled after the plug-in is included.

Manual Non-Secure Inclusion
1. Perform the steps in the INSTALLATION section above. If the plug-in has not already been included into a Z-Wave network, the LED indicator will blink rapidly. Otherwise, the plug-in has already been included and should first be excluded by following the instructions in the EXCLUSION section below.
2. Set your Z-WaveÂ® controller into learning mode (refer to your controller's manual for instructions).
3. Triple-click the Z-Button on the plug-in. The plug-in should be recognized and included into your Z-Wave network.

Manual Secure Inclusion
1. Perform the steps in the INSTALLATION section above. If the plug-in has not already been included into a Z-Wave network, the LED indicator will blink rapidly. Otherwise, the plug-in has already been included and should first be excluded by following the instructions in the EXCLUSION section below.
2. Set your Z-Wave controller into node secure mode (refer to your controller's manual for instructions).
3. Press and hold the Z-Button for about 3 seconds. The LED indicator will begin blinking rapidly and the plug-in should be recognized and included into your Z- Wave network.
metadata.exclusion:
1. Ensure that the plug-in is inserted into an AC outlet.
2. Set your Z-Wave controller into learning mode (refer to your controller's manual for instructions).
3. Triple-click the Z-Button. The plug-in will be removed from your Z-Wave network.
metadata.reset:
Note that the plug-in can only be reset if it is included in a Z-Wave network.
1. Ensure that the plug-in is inserted into an AC outlet.
2. Press and hold the Z-Button on the plug-in for more than 20 seconds. The LED indicator will illuminate steadily for about 3 seconds, then will begin blinking slowly.
